revised_title: Exploring Multiple Quantum Well Optical Nonlinearities and the Self Electro-Optic Device
tldr: This article discusses the nonlinear optical properties of GaAs-AlGaAs multiple quantum wells, which show large nonlinear absorption and refraction due to strong room-temperature exciton resonances. These properties make them suitable for all-optical devices. The article also introduces a new class of optical bistability caused by increasing absorption, which enables the creation of a mirrorless optical switch called the Self Electro-Optic Effect Device (SEED). The SEED has a low switching energy and is a significant improvement over other cavity devices.
